intro: Cytisogenista cantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
